Of course, it also depends upon what you mean by "last name" since f=
amily  
names in Japanese come before the personal name.  Then there are th=
e  
complications that samurai families often "adopted" sons to be their he=
irs if  
they had none (or, occasionally, if they simply weren't happy with=
 the ones 
they  had).  And, of course, to confuse things further, many oft=
en received new 
 names upon their deaths, in keeping with Buddhist traditi=
on.  
 
Or, put another way, Japanese nomenclature is a strikingly complica=
ted and  
frequently confusing game.
